TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit JobOutputStorage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents persistent storage for the outputs of an Azure Batch job.
Docs.remarks: Job outputs refer to output data logically associated with the entire job, rather than a particular task. For example, in a movie rendering job, if a task combined all the frames into a movie, that would logically be a job output. The purpose of categorising an output as a 'job' output is to save the client from having to know which task produced it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri jobOutputContainerUri) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL in Azure storage of the blob container to use for job outputs. This URL must contain a SAS (Shared Access Signature) granting access to the container, or the container must be public.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a URL representing the job output container.
Docs.remarks: The container must already exist; the JobOutputStorage class does not create it for you.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a storage account and job id.
Docs.remarks: The job output container must already exist; the JobOutputStorage class does not create it for you.

Docs.param: A representing the category of outputs to list, for example or .
Docs.summary: Lists the job outputs of the specified kind.
Docs.returns: A list of persisted job outputs of the specified kind.
Docs.remarks: The list is retrieved lazily from Azure blob storage when it is enumerated.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task SaveAsync (Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.JobOutputKind kind, string relativePath, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = null);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task SaveAsync(class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Conventions.Files.JobOutputKind kind, string relativePath, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the category under which to store this file, for example or .
The path of the file to save, relative to the current directory. If the file is in a subdirectory of the current directory, the relative path will be preserved in blob storage.
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified file to persistent storage.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
Docs.remarks: If the file is outside the current directory, traversals up the directory tree are removed. For example, a of "..\ProcessEnv.cmd" would be treated as "ProcessEnv.cmd" for the purposes of creating a blob name.
Docs.exception: The argument is an absolute path, or is empty.

The path of the file to save.
The blob name under which to save the file. This may include a relative component, such as "pointclouds/pointcloud_0001.txt".
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified file to persistent storage.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
